titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lumber merchant account book 1979.023
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-05-07 15:07:38 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection consists of one handwritten account book detailing purchases of wood, listing amount and quantities. The merchant, located in New York City, is unknown. The account book is dated 1837 to 1839.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Kenn Stryker-Rodda, date unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1979.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single item.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Lumber merchant account book, 1979.023, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one handwritten account book detailing purchases of wood, listing amount and quantities. The merchant, located in New York City, is unknown. The account book is dated 1837 to 1839.
There are also some penciled notes that appear to have been written by or for a child at the front and back of the volume, including a list of vocabulary words to define.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
